intro: Tabernaemontana glabrata, commonly known as the naked tabernacle. It is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and large, showy white or pale pink flowers. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
